summary: This bill, the Marc Fischer Memorial Interdiction of Fentanyl in Postal Mail at Federal Prisons Act, mandates the Bureau of Prisons to develop and implement a strategy to intercept fentanyl and other synthetic drugs entering federal correctional facilities through the mail. The strategy includes evaluating current technologies, ensuring digital mail scanning capacity, and providing digital copies to inmates within 24 hours. The bill outlines a timeline for implementation, requires annual progress reports, and addresses budgetary needs for equipment and technology upgrades. It aims to protect staff and inmates, combat the opioid crisis within prisons, and enhance security.
